document_data.name: Chardalyn Dragon
document_data.Description: Chardalyn dragons were constructs built with [[chardalyn]], a rare [[gem]]. Their wings were made from a strong, rubber-like substance.
document_data.Personality: Because of the demonic energy infusing it, a chardalyn dragon was a malevolent creature who relished in the suffering of others.
document_data.Abilities: Chardalyn dragons were powerful constructs. These constructs were immune to damage from the cold and poisoning. They had significant natural [[Magic resistance|magical resistance]] and were immune to fear and to paralyzing and petrifying effects and spells. Any spell that attempted to change a chardalyn dragon's form or structure failed. Chardalyn dragons emitted a powerful charm-like aura. Any sentient creature within {{SI|30|ft}} of the construct was vulnerable to this charm-like effect.
document_data.Combat:
[[File:Chardragon.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Adventurers squaring off against a chardalyn dragon]]
In combat, a chardalyn dragon attacked its target with its sharp claws and teeth. It used its powerful tail to smash an opponent, and its wings were strong enough to bludgeon a target.
document_data.Ecology: As constructs, chardalyn dragons did not require drink or food, nor did they require rest or sleep.
document_data.History: Circa the {{YearlinkName|1489}}, the [[duergar]] [[Xardorok Sunblight]] finished construction of a chardalyn dragon within his mountainside fortress of [[Sunblight]]. It was let loose from the [[duergar]] fortress to decimate the [[Ten Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]], flying first to the small village of [[Dougan's Hole]].
